private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest, E is largest among these).
I must only issue moves that involve disks A, B, C, D, or E.
agent_1.goal: Help achieve the target Tower of Hanoi configuration by producing an ordered list of primitive moves that only move disks A-E and respect the Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J (F is smallest among these, J is largest).
I must only issue moves that involve disks F, G, H, I, or J.
agent_2.goal: Help achieve the target Tower of Hanoi configuration by producing an ordered list of primitive moves that only move disks F-J and respect the Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents' move sequences and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move lists and produce a correct PDDL domain and PDDL problem (formatted for FastDownward) that models the 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with the given initial and goal states, keeping agent actions distinct.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, and right.
There are 10 disks labelled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J. A is the smallest disk, J is the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top->bottom) C; right peg is empty.

Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; a move consists of taking the top disk from one peg and placing it on top of another peg; a larger disk may never be placed on a smaller disk.
Agent restrictions: agent_1 may only move disks A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may only move disks F, G, H, I, J.

moves.system_prompt: You are an expert at producing correct, ordered primitive move sequences for puzzle manipulation. You should NOT produce PDDL. Produce only the ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to perform.

You are an expert at producing correct, ordered primitive move sequences for puzzle manipulation. You should NOT produce PDDL. Produce only the ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to perform.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in generating PDDL domains and problems specifically for the FastDownward planner. You must produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file that model the 3-peg Tower of Hanoi for the given instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions performed by agent_1 and agent_2 distinct (e.g., different action names or predicates) so their capabilities are explicit in the PDDL.
